alert.note: Alert for Greater Portland Metro Area (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 23 at 3:47AM PST until February 23 at 8:00AM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON PST FRIDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM PST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as zero. For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to 2 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph, especially near the Columbia Gorge. * WHERE...In Oregon, Greater Portland Metro Area. In Washington, Greater Vancouver Area. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, until noon PST Friday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 8 AM PST this morning. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Highest additional snow accumulations west of I-5 this morning.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1, or visit for Oregon: https://www.tripcheck.com and for Washington: https://wsdot.com/travel/real-time/map
